#summary cogX ( TextString Cog# - ) Command a forth cog to execute a forth word
#labels v2.7

= Cogx =

cogX ( TextString Cog# - ) Command a forth cog to execute a forth word

The word "cogX" takes the STRING defined by 

c" ThisIsTheString" 

and sends it to the input buffer of a cog.  The cog then starts to interpret the string, in this case the word "ThisIsTheString"

Example:  make a different cog do something

cog 4 will put a bunch of values on the stack of cog1

_cog4 ok_

*c" 1 2 3 " 1 cogX*

_ok_

CTL+A to cog1

_cog1 ok_

*st?*

_ST: 00000001 00000002 00000003_

_ok_

cogX does "send the string to the cog"; the cog then interprets the string
